description: A tour from Brentford to Isleworth.  An opportunity to reminisce about and view landscapes Turner painted while exploring buildings with which  he was familiar, ranging  from a surviving purpose built Georgian School of Industry to the grandeur of 16thC Syon House and 17thC Gordon House, both embellished by architect Robert Adam.

events.name: Celebrating JMW Turnerâ€™s 250th Anniversary
events.notes: Linear walking tour along the Thames from Kew Bridge through Brentford to Isleworth exploring sites Turner know and painted during his stays

factsheet.heading: About the walk
paragraphs: The walk will follow mostly paths and pavements along the Thames, through local parks and urban sites and scenes well known to Turner who lived in the  area as a child and later rented accommodation in order to be able to paint Thames side scenes that he knew and loved. There are some steps and uneven surfaces but it is mostly gentle walking conditions and close to rail and bus transport.

location.address: Outside Kew Bridge Station, Kew Bridge Road, Brentford, TW8 9QF
travel_info: Additional travel info: End point will be Isleworth  Promenade, Richmond Road, St Margarets from where H37 route goes to Richmond and/or Isleworth stations.

name: Celebrating JMW Turner's 250th Birthday
